info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 20 at 2:30PM EDT until May 20 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Berks County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 230 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fredericksburg to Myerstown to Timber Hills, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Kutztown, Hamburg, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Womelsdorf, Wernersville, Robesonia, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bernville, Lyons, Strausstown, Lenhartsville, Spring Ridge, Fairview Hgts, Shillington and West Reading. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 42. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 11. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for eastern Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for eastern Pennsylvania.
